Myth Vs Truth

Click on the cards for revealing the truth!!!

Myth








"Women are too sensitive"

Truth

Though research does say women have more edge than men to be sensitive but there are not many research studies to support this. Some men can be equally or more sensitive then women, It really depends person to person. There are also cultural perspectives and pressures which force men to not to be comfortable showing emotions and sensitivity so therefore men feel obliged to hide thier emotions and senstivities.

Myth








"Women are not strong. Men are much stronger. "

Truth

The definition of strength can be looked at from different perspectives. Strength is not merely physical but also mental, social and emotional. Although Men do have 20% more advantage when it comes to physical strength but that does not mean women cannot workout, take care of their bodies and be strong. DON‚ÄôT let anyone tell you, you are not strong enough. You can achieve anything you want, just believe in yourself!! Also there is NO evidence that men are socially, mentally and emotionally stronger than women. In fact women are found to be more emotionally intelligent then men according to the many current literature finds.

Myth








"Boys are naturally better at math than girls"

Truth

According to many studies there are NO gender differences in math ability in young boys and girls. The reason that we see more participations of boys in math and STEM related subjects is because of the cultural gender expectations and the physical environment they are influenced by. Boys are often talked to go towards STEM fields where as girls towards Humanities.

Myth








"Girls should be well behaved; boys are permitted to act out"

Truth

In many cultures women and girls are expected to social conformity, (It is another way to supress women and their freedom, voice and expression), Where as culturally misbehaviour of boys is ignored or not checked upon. It also depends on what children see is happening in their families as they see their elders as role models. There is no such thing as girls should be ‚Äúwell behaved‚Äù. Just be your Badass self! üòéüíã

Myth








"Boys should be directed to blue and green and girls to pink"

Truth

The colours is not much of a significance, It becomes an issue when the reason behind the choice of the colour is misinterpreted and associated with sexuality of boys who choose shades of pink over other. Just let it be, It is just a colour.

Myth








Boys should not wear dresses or ‚Äúgirl clothes‚Äù

Truth

When girls wear pants it is acceptable, Boys who wear dresses is seen at a stereotype threat and often related to their sexuality. Number of studies show that this is often not the case.

Myth








"Girls should be thin and beautiful to appeal to men "

Truth

Girls are often pressurized and are forced more by society to look thin and to look like one specific body type so that they appeal to men. There is no one ideal body type. All bodies are beautiful, You should be first happy and confident within yourself before thinking about what others would want you to look like in order to appeal them not. Beauty is a matter of perspective and everyone is beautiful in their own way. The skin colour or weight of your body does not determine your appeal. I believe real beauty and appeal is when you love yourself.

Myth








"Women are natural nurturers, men are natural leaders"

Truth

We often see that men in the house are working and earning money and women are responsible for the household. This is because of the cultural traditions passing on since centuries. These traditions however do not depict the capability of genders, Women can be natural leaders and there are women who are CEO‚Äôs of big corporations. There are other reasons why we don‚Äôt see as many women in big positions in the corporate sector like women are often discriminated and our judged not on their capability but stereotypes like ‚Äúwomen can‚Äôt make firm decisions‚Äù, ‚ÄúThey cannot analyse situations as good as men‚Äù. These obviously are not true, they are just stereotypes. There are many studies which showcase that typical women nature and quality can be recognized and be used as leadership skills. Read The book ‚ÄúWhy the best man for the job is a Woman‚Äù.

Myth








"Assertive women are unfeminine and are bossy "

Truth

Bieng assertive is not bad and unfeminine. it is a trait which should be valued in both women and men. Standing up for yourself and having an opinion in today‚Äôs world is quite crucial and should not be limited to gender, this an individual trait, being assertive is very different from being aggressive. Unfortunately many women who are assertive are often given names like being ‚Äúfeministic‚Äù, bossy, rude or considered having superiority complex. At the other side men or boys who are comfortable with women making decisions are called simps, henpecked husbands/boyfriends and are looked down upon and in fact should be equally respected.

Myth








"Men who spend time with family are less ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù and are poor breadwinners"

Truth

There are no strict definitions and roles that define a gender. The patriarchal society has labelled men as breadwinners and women as home makers which confine people to boxes. With Increase in quality education of both women and men, these roles are getting diffused. A Father that cares for his children and wife is masculine, loving and respected.

Myth








"Same sex couples cannot make good parents "

Truth

This is not true, it is just another way form of Homophobia. Same sex couples can be very good parents, Many studies have shown that children‚Äôs well-being is affected much more by their relationship with their parents, sense of security, social and economic support rather than their parent‚Äôs gender or sexual orientation.
